title: 2025 LLM Year in Review: Claude Code as First True AI Agent
description: Andrej Karpathy identifies Claude Code (CC) as 'the first convincing demonstration of what an LLM Agent looks like.' He describes it as an agent that iteratively uses tools in a loopy way and lives on your computer, showing the potential of AI agents for productivity, though fully automated engineers haven't arrived yet.
author: Andrej Karpathy

title: LLM Year in Review - Hacker News Discussion
description: Hacker News users discuss Andrej Karpathy's LLM Year in Review, with many noting that Claude Code was 'the most impressive innovation this year' and Cursor being 'a good proof of concept but Claude Code is the tool that...' delivered on the promise.
author: Hacker News Community

title: Sam Rose explains how LLMs work with a visual essay
description: Simon Willison shares Sam Rose's visual interactive explainer on LLM internals, covering prompt caching, tokenization, embeddings, and transformer architecture. Described as one of the clearest and most accessible introductions to how LLMs work.
author: Simon Willison

title: Your job is to deliver code you have proven to work
description: Simon Willison emphasizes that developers must deliver proven, tested code, not rely on code reviews to catch issues. He discusses the explosive growth of coding agents in 2025 and how to make AI agents prove their code works through manual and automated testing.
author: Simon Willison

title: 3 Techniques to Effectively Utilize AI Agents for Coding
description: Towards Data Science article exploring practical techniques for leveraging AI coding agents, discussing how AI agents have revolutionized programming and providing actionable strategies for developers.
author: Towards Data Science

title: AI coding is now everywhere. But not everyone is convinced.
description: MIT Technology Review analysis of the current state of AI coding tools, examining the productivity benefits versus developer concerns about AI-powered coding assistants in 2025.
author: MIT Technology Review

title: AI coding tools exploded in 2025. The first security exploits are already here
description: Fortune reports on critical vulnerabilities discovered in AI coding tools throughout 2025, highlighting how rapid AI adoption has outpaced security measures. Exploits are emerging as attackers target the expanded attack surface of AI-powered development environments.
author: Fortune

title: I ported JustHTML from Python to JavaScript with Codex CLI and GPT-5.2 in 4.5 hours
description: Simon Willison details his experience porting a Python library to JavaScript using AI coding tools (Codex CLI and GPT-5.2), completing the task in 4.5 hours and demonstrating the practical capabilities of AI-assisted development.
author: Simon Willison
